question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for display. Help me create an H5 page similar to Tencent's "Yuanbao" (digital currency) using a mobile development framework that can support rendering data returned from large language models.

checklist.title: Is the mobile H5 framework integration complete and optimized?
checklist.description: Review whether the code properly integrates mobile-first frameworks (Vue3/React with mobile UI libraries like Vant/Ant Design Mobile), includes viewport meta configuration, touch event handling, and mobile-specific optimizations. Score 0 if basic mobile framework is missing, 5 if only basic responsive layout is implemented, and 10 if comprehensive mobile optimization including gesture handling, scroll optimization, and performance tuning is fully implemented.

checklist.title: Is the large language model data rendering system robust and efficient?
checklist.description: Check whether the implementation includes streaming data parsing, markdown/rich text rendering capabilities, code syntax highlighting, and real-time content updates. Must support incremental rendering for long responses and handle various LLM output formats (text, code blocks, lists, tables). Deduct 5 points if streaming rendering is missing, 3 points if content formatting is poor, and 3 points if loading states are not handled properly. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the digital currency UI accurately replicate Tencent Yuanbao's design system?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the interface closely matches Tencent Yuanbao's visual hierarchy, including proper card layouts, currency display formats, transaction lists, and interactive elements. Must include authentic color schemes, typography, and component styling that reflects professional fintech design standards. Deduct 5 points if visual consistency is poor, 3 points if layout proportions are incorrect, and 5 points if key UI components are missing or poorly implemented. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the chat/conversation interface optimized for LLM interactions?
checklist.description: Check whether the code implements a conversation interface with proper message bubbles, typing indicators, auto-scroll behavior, and conversation history management. Must support various message types (text, images, files) and include features like message copying, regeneration, and conversation clearing. Deduct 5 points if conversation flow is awkward, 3 points if message display is inconsistent, and 3 points if interaction feedback is missing. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as API failures, network interruption, malformed LLM responses, touch gesture conflicts, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Voice input/output for LLM interactions 2. Smart content summarization and extraction 3. Multi-modal input support with image/document upload 4. Personalized conversation themes). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple message rendering systems coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to digital currency/LLM interaction (e.g., built-in games or irrelevant widgets) 3. Heavy animations that affect mobile performance (e.g., complex particle effects or excessive transitions). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating API layer/UI components/state management), TypeScript usage, component reusability, and build optimization for mobile. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or proper state management is not used; deduct 5 points if component coupling is too high; deduct 5 points if mobile build optimization (code splitting, lazy loading) is missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional fintech design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern fintech app principles: 1) Professional color scheme matching Tencent's brand guidelines 2) Proper mobile layout spacing (following 4px/8px grid system) 3) Clear information hierarchy with appropriate font sizes (≥16px for mobile readability, line height ≥1.4). Deduct 3 points for each cramped mobile layout element, 5 points for unprofessional color combinations, and 5 points for poor content readability on mobile devices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the mobile interaction smooth and touch-optimized?
checklist.description: Judge whether the mobile interactions conform to touch interface standards: 1) Touch feedback delay ≤ 100ms with proper haptic responses 2) Smooth scrolling and gesture recognition 3) Proper touch target sizes (≥44px) and spacing 4) Optimized for various screen sizes and orientations. Deduct 5 points for each unresponsive touch interaction, 3 points for scroll lag or gesture conflicts, and 5 points for poor accessibility on different mobile devices. The full score is 10 points.
